thread.title: Outdoor Calendar: KDWPT Commission meeting on fee changes set for Oct. 22 in Burlington
thread.title_full: Outdoor Calendar: KDWPT Commission meeting on fee changes set for Oct. 22 in Burlington

author: The Capital-Journal
title: Outdoor Calendar: KDWPT Commission meeting on fee changes set for Oct. 22 in Burlington
text:
Outdoor Calendar: KDWPT Commission meeting on fee changes set for Oct. 22 in Burlington Posted: October 17, 2015 - 5:58pm By The Capital-Journal 
OCTOBER 
18 — Mission Valley FFA fundraising shoot, 1 to 3 p.m. at Mission Valley schools. Contact Steven Foster at sfoster085@gmail.com . 
18 — Topeka Stix Fundraiser, 8 to 11 a.m., Ravenwood Lodge. Jason 608-9558. 
18 — Kansas B.A.S.S. Nation 2015 Youth 2-Man Team State Championship, 7 a.m. to 1 p.m., Milford Lake. 
18 — Wild Within You, LLC “Hell Creek on Heels,” 5K, 30K and 50K trail run, Wilson State Park Switchgrass Trail, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Sara Kay Carrell 650-1620. 
20-27 — Riley Co.-Manhattan hunter education course, Fancy Creek Range at Tuttle Creek State Park, 6 to 10 p.m. Pre-registration at Tuttle Creek State Park Office, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. 
22 — KDWPT Commission meeting, 1 p.m., Coffey County Library Conference Room, Burlington. Will include­ final voting and adoption for fee changes. 
24 — Virgil Brown Memorial Fishing Tournament, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., John Redmond Reservoir. $50 per boat, includes $10 Big Fish per boat. Cash payouts will be paid for first, second and third place. Ty Wolf (620) 341-2129. 
24 — Oregon Trail Ducks Unlimited Banquet, St. Stan Church Hall, Rossville. Doors open at 5:30 p.m.$35 per person, $50 couple, $300 table. Jeff 224-9924. 
24 — European Pheasant Hunt, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
24 — Haunted Trail, Hedgewood Trail at Pomona State Park, 7 to 10 p.m. Park office 828-4933. 
25 — Mission Valley FFA fundraising shoot, 1 to 3 p.m. at Mission Valley schools. Contact Steven Foster at sfoster085@gmail.com . 
31 — Midwest Highland Arts Fun Shoot to benefit Winter Storm, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
NOVEMBER 
1 — Trick or Treat Shoot, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
6 — Brown County Quail Forever Chapter Banquet, 6 p.m., Fisher Center in Hiawatha. Information available and tickets can be purchased online at http://pheasantsforeverevents.org/event/1155 . Doors open at 5:30 p.m. 
7 — Brown County Quail Forever Chapter Youth Hunt (ages 11-16). Applications available from Larry Weast at 785-547-6186 or stonypoint@hughes.net . 
7 — Pheasant Hunter Warm Up Scramble, Ravenwood Lodge. 50 targets each. (800) 656-2454. 
7-8 — NUCS bird dog trial, Double Crown Ranch west of Topeka. All pointing dogs judged Nov. 7, flushing dogs Nov. 8. Open, amateur and doubles both days. 40 percent payback. Contact Sam Martin (417) 438-3111 or martin.sam@sbcglobal.net . 
15 — Wild Turkey 100, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
22 — Fall Doubles Classic, 100 targets each. Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
28 — European Driven Pheasant Hunt, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
29 — Bob White .410 ‘50’ at Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
DECEMBER 
13 — Winter Open 100, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
20 — European Driven Pheasant Hunt, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
27 — Ravenwood 3-person Team Shoot 100, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
JANUARY 
1 — New Years Day Survivors Shoot Off, 1 to 4 p.m., Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
17 — Polar Bear Classic, Ravenwood Lodge. (800) 656-2454. 
To submit an item for the Outdoors calendar , contact The Capital-Journal by fax: (785) 295-1230 or email at joshua.rouse@cjonline.com . View the complete calendar online.
